page.title: 15BLACKMORE VALE POOR FARMLAND
page.content: Roughly half 0374/0115 is the estate of a Georgian mansion standing in 250 acres of open land.200 years old,it is being extensively restored.There are many outbuildings,stables and barns, three cottages and a detached house. The land has been well landscaped with many fine oak ash and beech but none of the pasture is used for dairy cattle,only for three riding horses. The other part of this area has the Caundle Brook meeting the River Lydden and little use appears to be made of the water-meadows(easily flooded).The remainder of the pasture consists of outlying fields of a neighbouring farm with a large herd of Friesians. The waterways are choked with reeds, rushes and debris.There are few places for fishing.No waterfowl but these fields abound with foxes,badgers and rabbits.There are few butterflies.
